question:
Fill in the following blanks. Choose your answers from the options given:
In Python, A is the base class of all exceptions.
Hint: find out from Python doc :

description.option: BaseException is the base class for all built-in exceptions.

question:
Fill in the following blanks. Choose your answers from the options given:
As per Python doc, user defined Exception should inherit from A class.
Hint: find out from Python doc :

description.option:
All built-in, non-system-exiting exceptions are derived from Exception class.
All user-defined exceptions should also be derived from this class.

question: Consider the following code snippet and Predict the output, select all correct options

options.option: a: If input is “a” then #Statement2 will execute
b: If input is “5” then output will show Container capacity=0
c: If input is “0” then first #Statement1 and then  #Statement2 is executed
d: If input is “-1” then #Statement2 will execute

description.A: option A is correct. Execute the code to see other correct answers.
description.B: option B is correct. Execute the code to see other correct answers.
description.C: option C is incorrect. only one exception block is executed
description.D: input 'a' will result in an exception since it is not a valid int, breadth 5 will make it too big to fit in container cube so Capacity will be zero. A negative breadth (-1) will result in raising an exception.

question: Consider the following code snippet and predict the output.

options.option: a: First -1- and then -2- will be printed
c: First -2- and then -1- will be printed

description.A: finally block will always be executed after except if present hence just before return statement it will print -2- and then return. Try to see the flow using eclipse debugger.
description.B: Try to see the flow using eclipse debugger
description.C: Try to see the flow using eclipse debugger.
description.D: Not an Error. Try to see the flow using eclipse debugger.
